elements.name: ExistingOrdersFLM
elements.title: Are there any existing written agreements or court `orders` about parenting arrangements, `child support`, contact with a child, guardianship of a child and/or spousal support?
elements.description: A written agreement includes a separation agreement or mediation agreement. A court order made be from any court in any place, including the Supreme Court.

elements.name: attachCopyOfExistingOrders
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your written agreement(s) or court order(s) when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: existingOrdersListFLM
elements.title: Please select which family law matter issue your existing written agreement or court order is about:
choices: Parenting Arrangements including `parental responsibilities` and `parenting time`

elements.name: existingPOOrders
elements.title: Are there any existing court `orders` protecting one of the parties or restraining contact between the parties, including protection orders, peace bonds, restraining orders, bail conditions or other criminal orders?
elements.description:
This includes:
  • any family law protection order from Provincial Court, Supreme Court, or another jurisdiction
  • any criminal order or conditions protecting a party or restraining/restricting contact between the parties
  • any peace bonds
  • any other order the court may need to know about that restricts or restrains contact, or protects one party and/or a child from another party

elements.name: attachCopyOfExistingPOOrders
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your order(s) when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: howPartiesRelated
elements.title: Describe how you and each other party are related for the purposes of this application
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording. Describe the relationship or connection in your own words, for example, we were living together in a relationship and are both parents of the child. If there is more than one other party, be clear about the relationship or connection to each of them.

elements.name: werePOPartiesMarried
elements.title: Is the other party your spouse (or has been a spouse) OR do you and the other party live (or has lived) together in a marriage-like relationship?

elements.name: spouseFAQ
elements.title: What is a spouse?
elements.body:
Spouses can include both married and unmarried individuals. A spouse is a person:
  • who is married to another person, or
  • has lived with another person in a marriage-like relationship (commonly called a common law relationship), and
    1. has lived with the other person for at least 2 years without a break, or
    2. has a child with the other person

elements.name: isSeperated
elements.title: Are you and the other party currently separated?
elements.description: Spouses may be separated while continuing to live in the same residence

elements.description: There is no requirement to share but sometimes there is information you may choose to share with the court to help them in considering your application.
